comment: A surjective continuous function from ` J ` to ` K ` induces a topology ` J qTop F ` on the base set of ` K ` . This topology is in general finer than ` K ` . Together with ~ qtopid , this implies that ` J qTop F ` is the finest topology making ` F ` continuous, i.e. the final topology with respect to the family ` { F } ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Mar-2015.)
